001package imagingbook.common.math.eispack;
002
003public abstract class QZIT {
004        
005        // EISPACK Routines, see http://www.netlib.org/eispack/
006
007        /**
008         * <p>
009         * This subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm for solving
010         * generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10,
011         * 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart, as modified in technical note NASA TN
012         * D-7305(1973) by Ward. 
013         * This description has been adapted from the original version
014         * (dated August 1983).
015         * </p>
016         * <p>
017         * This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in upper
018         * Hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form. It reduces the
019         * Hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using orthogonal transformations
020         * while maintaining the triangular form of the other matrix. It is usually
021         * preceded by qzhes and followed by qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
022         * </p>
023         * <p>
024         * On output:
025         * </p>
026         * <ul>
027         * <li><strong>a</strong> has been reduced to quasi-triangular form. The elements 
028         * below the first subdiagonal are still zero and no two consecutive subdiagonal
029         * elements are nonzero.</li>
030         * 
031         * <li><strong>b</strong> is still in upper triangular form, although its elements have been altered.
032         * the location b(n,1) is used to store eps1 times the norm of b for later use
033         * by qzval and qzvec.
034         * 
035         * <li><strong>z</strong> contains the product of the right hand transformations (for both steps) if
036         * matz has been set to true.</li>
037         * </ul>
038         * 
039         * 
040         * @param a    contains a real upper hessenberg matrix.
041         * @param b    contains a real upper triangular matrix.
042         * @param eps1 is a tolerance used to determine negligible elements. eps1 = 0.0
043         *             (or negative) may be input, in which case an element will be
044         *             neglected only if it is less than roundoff error times the norm
045         *             of its matrix. If the input eps1 is positive, then an element
046         *             will be considered negligible if it is less than eps1 times the
047         *             norm of its matrix. A positive value of eps1 may result in faster
048         *             execution, but less accurate results.
049         * @param matz should be set to true if the right hand transformations are to be
050         *             accumulated for later use in computing eigenvectors, and to false
051         *             otherwise.
052         * @param z    contains, if matz has been set to true, the transformation matrix
053         *             produced in the reduction by qzhes, if performed, or else the
054         *             identity matrix. If matz has been set to false, z is not
055         *             referenced.
056         * @return -1 for normal return, j if the limit of 30*n iterations is exhausted
057         *         while the j-th eigenvalue is being sought.
058         */
059        public static int qzit(double[][] a, double[][] b, double eps1, boolean matz, double[][] z) {
060
061                final int n = a.length;
062                
063                int i, j, k, l = 0;
064                double r, s, t, a1 = 0, a2 = 0, a3 = 0;
065                int k1, k2, l1 = 0, ll;
066                double u1, u2, u3;
067                double v1, v2, v3;
068                double a11 = 0, a12, a21 = 0, a22, a33 = 0, a34 = 0, a43 = 0, a44 = 0;
069                double b11 = 0, b12, b22 = 0, b33, b34 = 0, b44;
070                int na = 0, en, ld = 0;
071                double ep;
072                double sh = 0;
073                int km1, lm1 = 0;
074                double ani, bni;
075                int ish = 0, itn, its = 0, enm2 = 0, lor1;
076                double epsa, epsb, anorm, bnorm;
077                int enorn;
078                boolean notlas;
079        
080                int ierr = -1;          // no error 
081        
082                // compute epsa and epsb
083                anorm = 0.0;
084                bnorm = 0.0;
085                              
086                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
087                        ani = 0.0;
088                        if (i != 0) {
089                                ani = (Math.abs(a[i][(i - 1)]));
090                        }
091                        bni = 0.0;
092                        
093                        for (j = i; j < n; j++) {
094                                ani += Math.abs(a[i][j]);
095                                bni += Math.abs(b[i][j]);
096                        }
097        
098                        if (ani > anorm) {
099                                anorm = ani;
100                        }
101                        if (bni > bnorm) {
102                                bnorm = bni;
103                        }
104                }
105        
106                if (anorm == 0.0) {
107                        anorm = 1.0;
108                }
109                if (bnorm == 0.0) {
110                        bnorm = 1.0;
111                }
112        
113//              ep = eps1;
114//              if (ep == 0.0) {
115//                      // use round-off level if eps1 is zero
116//                      ep = epsilon(1.0);
117//              }
118                ep = (eps1 > 0) ? eps1 : epslon(1.0);
119                epsa = ep * anorm;
120                epsb = ep * bnorm;
121        
122                // rReduce a to quasi-triangular form, while keeping b triangular
123                lor1 = 0;
124                enorn = n;
125                en = n - 1;
126                itn = n * 30;
127                
128                // ------------------------------------------
129        
130                State state = State.L60;
131                StateLoop: while (state != State.Final) {
132                        switch (state) {
133        
134                        case L60: 
135                                // Begin QZ step
136                                if (en <= 1) {
137                                        state = State.L1001;
138                                        break;
139                                }
140                                if (!matz) {
141                                        enorn = en + 1;
142                                }
143                                its = 0;
144                                na = en - 1;
145                                enm2 = na;
146                                state = State.L70;
147                                break;
148        
149                        case L70:
150                                ish = 2;
151                                // check for convergence or reducibility.
152                                for (ll = 0; ll <= en; ++ll) {
153                                        lm1 = en - ll - 1;
154                                        l = lm1 + 1;
155                                        if (l == 0) {
156                                                state = State.L95;
157                                                continue StateLoop;             // check again!!
158                                        }
159                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= epsa) {
160                                                state = State.L90;
161                                                break;
162                                        }
163                                }
164                                state = State.L90;
165                                break;
166        
167                        case L90:
168                                a[l][lm1] = 0.0;
169                                if (l < na) {
170                                        state = State.L95;
171                                        break;
172                                }
173                                // 1-by-1 or 2-by-2 block isolated
174                                en = lm1;
175                                state = State.L60;
176                                break;
177        
178                        case L95: 
179                                // check for small top of b
180                                ld = l;
181                                state = State.L100;
182                                break;
183        
184                        case L100:
185                                l1 = l + 1;
186                                b11 = b[l][l];
187        
188                                if (Math.abs(b11) > epsb) {
189                                        state = State.L120;
190                                        break;
191                                }
192        
193                                b[l][l] = 0.0;
194                                s = Math.abs(a[l][l]) + Math.abs(a[l1][l]);
195                                u1 = a[l][l] / s;
196                                u2 = a[l1][l] / s;
197//                              r = Special.Sign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2), u1);
198                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
199                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
200                                v2 = -u2 / r;
201                                u2 = v2 / v1;
202        
203                                for (j = l; j < enorn; j++) {
204                                        t = a[l][j] + u2 * a[l1][j];
205                                        a[l][j] = a[l][j] + t * v1;
206                                        a[l1][j] = a[l1][j] + t * v2;
207        
208                                        t = b[l][j] + u2 * b[l1][j];
209                                        b[l][j] = b[l][j] + t * v1;
210                                        b[l1][j] = b[l1][j] + t * v2;
211                                }
212        
213                                if (l != 0) {
214                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
215                                }
216                                lm1 = l;
217                                l = l1;
218                                state = State.L90;
219                                break;
220        
221                        case L120:
222                                a11 = a[l][l] / b11;
223                                a21 = a[l1][l] / b11;
224                                if (ish == 1) {
225                                        state = State.L140;
226                                        break;
227                                }
228                                // iteration strategy
229                                if (itn == 0) {
230                                        state = State.L1000;
231                                        break;
232                                }
233                                if (its == 10) {
234                                        state = State.L155;
235                                        break;
236                                }
237        
238                                // determine type of shift
239                                b22 = b[l1][l1];
240                                if (Math.abs(b22) < epsb) {
241                                        b22 = epsb;
242                                }
243                                b33 = b[na][na];
244                                if (Math.abs(b33) < epsb) {
245                                        b33 = epsb;
246                                }
247                                b44 = b[en][en];
248                                if (Math.abs(b44) < epsb)
249                                        b44 = epsb;
250                                a33 = a[na][na] / b33;
251                                a34 = a[na][en] / b44;
252                                a43 = a[en][na] / b33;
253                                a44 = a[en][en] / b44;
254                                b34 = b[na][en] / b44;
255                                t = 0.5 * (a43 * b34 - a33 - a44);
256                                r = t * t + a34 * a43 - a33 * a44;
257                                if (r < 0.0) {
258                                        state = State.L150;
259                                        break;
260                                }
261        
262                                // determine single shift zero-th column of a
263                                ish = 1;
264                                r = Math.sqrt(r);
265                                sh = -t + r;
266                                s = -t - r;
267                                if (Math.abs(s - a44) < Math.abs(sh - a44)) {
268                                        sh = s;
269                                }
270        
271                                // look for two consecutive small sub-diagonal elements of a.
272                                for (ll = ld; ll < enm2; ll++) {
273                                        l = enm2 + ld - ll - 1;
274                                        if (l == ld) {
275                                                state = State.L140;
276                                                //break loop130;
277                                                continue StateLoop;
278                                        }
279                                        lm1 = l - 1;
280                                        l1 = l + 1;
281//                                      t = a[l + 1][l + 1];    // CHECK THIS!!
282                                        t = a[l][l];
283        
284                                        if (Math.abs(b[l][l]) > epsb) {
285                                                t = t - sh * b[l][l];
286                                        }
287        
288                                        if (Math.abs(a[l][lm1]) <= Math.abs(t / a[l1][l]) * epsa) {
289                                                state = State.L100;
290                                                continue StateLoop;
291                                        }
292                                }
293                                state = State.L140;
294                                break;
295        
296                        case L140:
297                                a1 = a11 - sh;
298                                a2 = a21;
299                                if (l != ld) {
300                                        a[l][lm1] = -a[l][lm1];
301                                }
302                                state = State.L160;
303                                break;
304        
305                        case L150: 
306                                // determine double shift zero-th column of a
307                                a12 = a[l][l1] / b22;
308                                a22 = a[l1][l1] / b22;
309                                b12 = b[l][l1] / b22;
310                                a1 = ((a33 - a11) * (a44 - a11) - a34 * a43 + a43 * b34 * a11) / a21 + a12 - a11 * b12;
311                                a2 = a22 - a11 - a21 * b12 - (a33 - a11) - (a44 - a11) + a43 * b34;
312                                a3 = a[l1 + 1][l1] / b22;
313                                state = State.L160;
314                                break;
315        
316                        case L155: 
317                                // ad hoc shift
318                                a1 = 0.0;
319                                a2 = 1.0;
320                                a3 = 1.1605;                    // magic!
321                                state = State.L160;
322                                break;
323        
324                        case L160:
325                                its = its + 1;
326                            itn = itn - 1;
327                                if (!matz) {
328                                        lor1 = ld;
329                                }
330        
331                                mainloop: for (k = l; k <= na; k++) {
332                                        notlas = (k != na && ish == 2);
333                                        k1 = k + 1;
334                                        k2 = k + 2;
335                                        km1 = Math.max(k, l + 1) - 1;
336                                        ll = Math.min(en, k1 + ish);
337        
338                                        if (!notlas) {
339                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1)
340                                                if (k != l) {
341                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
342                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
343                                                }
344        
345                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2);
346                                                if (s == 0.0) {
347                                                        state = State.L70;
348                                                        continue StateLoop;
349                                                }
350                                                u1 = a1 / s;
351                                                u2 = a2 / s;
352                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
353                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
354                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
355                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
356        
357                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
358                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j];
359                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
360                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
361        
362                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j];
363                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
364                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
365                                                }
366        
367                                                if (k != l) {
368                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
369                                                }
370                                                // goto L240;
371                                        }
372        
373                                        else {
374                                                // zero a(k+1,k-1) and a(k+2,k-1)
375                                                //L190:
376                                                if (k != l) {
377                                                        a1 = a[k][km1];
378                                                        a2 = a[k1][km1];
379                                                        a3 = a[k2][km1];
380                                                }
381                                                //L200:
382                                                s = Math.abs(a1) + Math.abs(a2) + Math.abs(a3);
383                                                if (s == 0.0) {
384                                                        continue mainloop;      // goto L260;
385                                                }
386                                                u1 = a1 / s;
387                                                u2 = a2 / s;
388                                                u3 = a3 / s;
389                                                r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
390                                                v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
391                                                v2 = -u2 / r;
392                                                v3 = -u3 / r;
393                                                u2 = v2 / v1;
394                                                u3 = v3 / v1;
395        
396                                                for (j = km1; j < enorn; j++) {
397                                                        t = a[k][j] + u2 * a[k1][j] + u3 * a[k2][j];
398                                                        a[k][j] = a[k][j] + t * v1;
399                                                        a[k1][j] = a[k1][j] + t * v2;
400                                                        a[k2][j] = a[k2][j] + t * v3;
401        
402                                                        t = b[k][j] + u2 * b[k1][j] + u3 * b[k2][j];
403                                                        b[k][j] = b[k][j] + t * v1;
404                                                        b[k1][j] = b[k1][j] + t * v2;
405                                                        b[k2][j] = b[k2][j] + t * v3;
406                                                }
407        
408                                                if (k != l) {
409                                                        a[k1][km1] = 0.0;
410                                                        a[k2][km1] = 0.0;
411                                                }
412        
413                                                // zero b(k+2,k+1) and b(k+2,k)
414                                                s = Math.abs(b[k2][k2]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k1]) + Math.abs(b[k2][k]);
415                                                if (s != 0.0) {
416                                                        u1 = b[k2][k2] / s;
417                                                        u2 = b[k2][k1] / s;
418                                                        u3 = b[k2][k] / s;
419                                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.sqrt(u1 * u1 + u2 * u2 + u3 * u3), u1);
420                                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
421                                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
422                                                        v3 = -u3 / r;
423                                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
424                                                        u3 = v3 / v1;
425        
426                                                        for (i = lor1; i < ll + 1; i++) {
427                                                                t = a[i][k2] + u2 * a[i][k1] + u3 * a[i][k];
428                                                                a[i][k2] = a[i][k2] + t * v1;
429                                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v2;
430                                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v3;
431        
432                                                                t = b[i][k2] + u2 * b[i][k1] + u3 * b[i][k];
433                                                                b[i][k2] = b[i][k2] + t * v1;
434                                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v2;
435                                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v3;
436                                                        }
437        
438                                                        b[k2][k] = 0.0;
439                                                        b[k2][k1] = 0.0;
440        
441                                                        if (matz) {
442                                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
443                                                                        t = z[i][k2] + u2 * z[i][k1] + u3 * z[i][k];
444                                                                        z[i][k2] = z[i][k2] + t * v1;
445                                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v2;
446                                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v3;
447                                                                }
448                                                        }
449                                                }
450                                        }
451        
452                                        // L240:
453                                        // zero b(k+1,k)
454                                        s = (Math.abs(b[k1][k1])) + (Math.abs(b[k1][k]));
455                                        if (s == 0.0) {
456                                                continue;       // goto L260;
457                                        }
458                                        u1 = b[k1][k1] / s;
459                                        u2 = b[k1][k] / s;
460                                        r = Math.copySign(Math.hypot(u1, u2), u1);
461                                        v1 = -(u1 + r) / r;
462                                        v2 = -u2 / r;
463                                        u2 = v2 / v1;
464        
465                                        for (i = lor1; i <= ll; i++) {
466                                                t = a[i][k1] + u2 * a[i][k];
467                                                a[i][k1] = a[i][k1] + t * v1;
468                                                a[i][k] = a[i][k] + t * v2;
469        
470                                                t = b[i][k1] + u2 * b[i][k];
471                                                b[i][k1] = b[i][k1] + t * v1;
472                                                b[i][k] = b[i][k] + t * v2;
473                                        }
474        
475                                        b[k1][k] = 0.0;
476        
477                                        if (matz) {
478                                                for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
479                                                        t = z[i][k1] + u2 * z[i][k];
480                                                        z[i][k1] = z[i][k1] + t * v1;
481                                                        z[i][k] = z[i][k] + t * v2;
482                                                }
483                                        }
484                                        // L260: ;
485                                }
486        
487                                state = State.L70; // end qz step
488                                break;
489        
490                        case L1000: 
491                                // set error -- all eigenvalues have not converged after 30*n iterations
492                                ierr = en + 1;
493                                state = State.L1001;
494                                break;
495        
496                        case L1001: 
497                                // save epsb for use by qzval and qzvec
498                                if (n > 1) {
499                                        b[n - 1][0] = epsb;
500                                }
501                                state = State.Final;
502                                break;
503        
504                        case Final:
505                                throw new RuntimeException("this should never happen!");
506                        }
507                }
508        
509                return ierr;    // return eigenvalue index if iteration count exceeded
510        } // end of qzit()
511        
512
513        private enum State {
514                L60, L70, L90, L95, L100, L120, L140, L150, L155, L160, L1000, L1001, Final;
515        }
516
517        private static double EpsDouble;
518        static {
519                double eps;
520                double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
521                do {
522                        double b = a - 1.0;
523                        double c = b + b + b;
524                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
525                } while (eps == 0);
526                EpsDouble = eps;
527        }
528        
529        private static float EpsFloat;
530        static {
531                float eps;
532                float a = 4.0f / 3.0f;
533                do {
534                        float b = a - 1.0f;
535                        float c = b + b + b;
536                        eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0f);
537                } while (eps == 0);
538                EpsFloat = eps;
539        }
540 
541        /**
542         * Estimates unit round-off in quantities of size x.
543         * This is a port of the epsilon function from EISPACK.
544         * See also
545         * https://www.researchgate.net/publication/2860253_A_Comment_on_the_Eispack_Machine_Epsilon_Routine
546         * 
547         * @param x some quantity
548         * @return returns the smallest number e of the same kind as x such that 1 + e > 1.
549         */
550        private static double epslon(double x) {
551//              double eps;
552//              double a = 4.0 / 3.0;
553//              do {
554//                      double b = a - 1.0;
555//                      double c = b + b + b;
556//                      eps = Math.abs(c - 1.0);
557//              } while (eps == 0);
558                return EpsDouble * Math.abs(x);
559        }
560        
561        private static float epslon(float x) {
562                return EpsFloat * Math.abs(x);
563                
564        }
565        
566/* original FORTRAN code:
567           a = 4.0d0/3.0d0
568        10 b = a - 1.0d0
569           c = b + b + b
570           eps = dabs(c-1.0d0)
571           if (eps .eq. 0.0d0) go to 10
572           epslon = eps*dabs(x)
573           return
574           end
575*/
576        
577/*
578program test_epsilon
579    real :: x = 3.143
580    real(8) :: y = 2.33
581    print *, epsilon(x)
582    print *, epsilon(y)
583end program test_epsilon
584 */
585        
586        public static void main(String[] args) {
587                double x = 3.143;
588                System.out.println(epslon(x));
589                float y = 2.33f;
590                System.out.println(epslon(y));
591                
592        }
593
594}
